p: For the Danish birds, temperature and habitat preferences were not independent: urban birds tended to have warmer temperature preferences, followed by farmland birds, and finally forest species ( Fig 3a, F 2,33 = 4.18, P = 0.02). Both temperature preference and habitat preference explained speciesâ€™ long-term trends: warm-adapted species have increased more than cool-adapted ones and forest birds have increased more than farmland birds ( Table 1).
